Description: 7 beads made of different shapes and materials. A: One bead in a flattened cylindrical shape, made of faience with a white glaze, on both flat sides a horizontal line at the same height in brown glaze, one of them very faint. B: Two small cylindrical segmented beads, each only 2 segments preserved, made of a vivid dark turquoise faience. C: Two disc-shaped beads, made of ostrich eggshell, quite rough and uneven. D: Two ring beads made of faience, stuck together by drying, with remains of a greenish glaze.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D15.N, Mound β, level 1
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
